snippet: The teams in poor countries that will be created by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation could also possibly spot emerging epidemics.
abstract: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation will make initial donation of $75 million to establish network of disease-surveillance teams, initially in six countries, that will seek causes of child mortality in impoverished regions and also spot emerging epidemics; member organizations will include Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Emory University's Global Health Institute.
lead_paragraph: The teams in poor countries that will be created by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation could also possibly spot emerging epidemics.

headline.main: Gates Foundation Plans Teams to Determine Causes of Child Mortality
headline.print_headline: Gates to Fund Child Mortality Initiative

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
